qas.question: What does Utrecht provide for cyclist

answers.text: Utrecht has an extensive network of cycle paths, making cycling safe and popular. 33% of journeys within the city are by bicycle

qas.question: What is a barrow bikes use

answers.text: There are also barrow bikes, for carrying shopping or small children

qas.question: utrecht built the worlds largest what ?

answers.text: in 2014 to build the world's largest bicycle parking station, near the Central Railway Station

qas.question: What percentage of journey's Dutch cities are by bicycle?
What accounts for 30% of trips in Dutch cities?

plausible_answers.text: the world's largest bicycle parking station

qas.question: What will construction begin on in 2018?
When did the city council decide to prohibit parking bikes in the city center?

context: Like most Dutch cities, <a0_0>Utrecht has an extensive network of cycle paths, making cycling safe and popular. <b3_0>33%<b3_0/> of journeys within the city are by bicycle<a0_0/>, more than any other mode of transport. (<b4_0>Cars<b4_0/>, for example, account for 30% of trips). Bicycles are used by young and old people, and by individuals and families. They are mostly traditional, upright, steel-framed bicycles, with few or no gears. <a1_0>There are also barrow bikes, for carrying shopping or small children<a1_0/>. As thousands of bicycles are parked haphazardly in town, creating an eyesore but also impeding pedestrians, the City Council decided <a2_0>in <b6_0>2014<b6_0/> to build <b5_0>the world's largest bicycle parking station<b5_0/>, near the Central Railway Station<a2_0/>. This 3-floor construction will cost an estimated 48 million Euro and will hold 12,500 bicycles. Completion is foreseen in 2018.
